zone.line: voured to cast off this terrible remembrance,
it still hung on him untill memory
was too great a burthen for his loaded
soul, but when ^^on horseback the spell that seeming-
ly held him to this idea wasr snapt;
then if he thought of his lost bride
he pictured her radiant in beauty;
he could hear her voice, and fancy her
"a sylvan Huntress by his side," while
his o eyes brightened as he thought he
gazed on her cherished form. I had
had several times seen him ride
ar across the heath and felt angry that
my solitude should be disturbed. It
was so long I had spoken to any but
peasants that I felt a disagreable
sensation at being gazed on by one
of superior rank. I feared also that
it might be some one who had seen
b me before: I might be recognized; my
impostures discovered and I dragged back
to a life of worse torture than that
